answers.answer: I am not a physician, but a volunteer and the mom of a type 1. I know that our JDRF coffee we have both children and adult type 1 diabetics.  I would suggest you contact your local hospitals too see what they have. I would also check out the following websites to help you be in contact with others.www.jdrf.org - there is a link to contact your local Tucson chapter they might be able to put you in contact with local groups.www.childrenwithdiabetes.com- there are several chat rooms, I know that in the parents

I am not sure what the standing is now with you and your wife since this post is from 2006. I currently live in Tucson, and have had Diabetes for 18 years. I would love to meet with other people, or a couple people for some good conversation and such.

I am not sure what the standing is now with you and your wife since this post is from 2006. I currently live in Tucson, and have had Diabetes for 18 years. I would love to meet with other people, or a couple people for some good conversation and such.

I am creating a type 1 diabetes support group to share experiences, knowledge, tips and support. I have had type 1 diabetes for 28 years. I have an insulin pump and continuous glucose monitoring system. If you are interested in joining me please contact me at ***@****.

I have just moved to Tucson.  I have been a type 1 diabetic for nearly 50 years and have had a pump for a little over 12.  Were you able to get a group going?  I would be interested in meeting other diabetics and get recommendations for  doctors, etc.Dawn Fode (***@****

The Tucson Pumpers (or the Tucson Pump Club) meets at the CareMore on the northwest corner of Kolb and Speedway the first Tuesday of every month from 6:30 to 7:30 pm. I have found that support group to be extremely helpful.

question: There are alot of Juvenille support groups and many Type-2 support groups but my wife and I would love to join or even start a support group for adult Type-1's. Something even as small as a meeting between another person to chat about experiences. My wife has had Diabetes for 24 years. Any takers? Any idea's.I'm new to forums so I apologize in advance if I'm out of place with this post.Thank You.
title: Looking for support groups for Adult Type-1's in The Tucson Area
